text:
Summary



Sun Pharmaceutical’s subsidiary Taro Pharma reported a strong performance during the previous quarter.Axis Bank board to meet on November 10 to consider raising funds.Three Pillars Pte. to sell up to 19.99 crore shares of Bharti Airtel in the range of Rs 473-480 per share.Akzo Nobel to divest India’s specialty chemical business, likely to garner for Rs 320 crore.






Indian equity benchmarks fell most in over a month on Tuesday, dragged by losses in pharma and energy shares. The S&P BSE Sensex fell 1.07 percent to 33,370.76 and the NSE Nifty 50 Index declined 0.97 percent to 10,350.The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India, fell 0.11 percent to 10,399 as of 7:00 a.m today.
title: Stocks To Watch:  Axis Bank,  Akzo Nobel, Ashok Leyland, Bharti Airtel, IOB
